othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Explains workflow transition mechanics, rule validation, approvals and execution of stage changes.

ul.li: A workflow is associated with the record.
You are a stakeholder for the particular status in the workflow.
You are invited to the project.
You have edit permission on the form or document.
Workflow action is pending on you.

body.context: Performing a workflow action in a record transitions therecord from its current workflow status to the subsequent workflow status based on the definition of the workflow. A workflow status is transitioned to the subsequent workflow status based on the workflow action conditions defined. For information on action conditions, refer to Creating a Workflow, Action Condition Configuration.

li.p: Open a form list page or document list page.

p.note: You can view the workflow status of a record in the Workflow Stage column of the list page.

li.p: Perform either of the following steps:

ul.li: Select multiple records that are in the same workflow status and have the same workflow associated with them.
Select the appropriate record, and then click Edit.

li.p: Click Select Actions, and then click the appropriate workflow action.
Available actions are based on the definition of the associatedworkflow.
The Notes dialog box is displayed.
Optionally, in the Notes box, enter the notes for the workflow transition.
You can access these notes from the Workflow History dialog box. For information on viewing the history of workflow transitions of the record, refer to Workflow History.
In the Set Days To Complete for Next Stage box, enter the number of days for completion of the current status.
Optionally, in the ATTACHMENTS section, you can attach or link related documents.
For additional information on attachments, refer to Attachments.
You can access these documents from the Workflow History dialog box. For information on viewing the history of workflow transitions of the record, refer to Workflow History.

ul.li: Specific workflow statuses cannot be reverted to the previous workflow status. To check if a workflow state can be reverted, click Status in the list page.
Certain fields in a form may not be available for entry or selection based on the current workflow status of the record.
